title: Epstein affair: French prosecutors announce special team of magistrates to investigate suspected crimes
subhead: The new team will work closely with prosecutors and police with a view to opening investigations into any suspected crimes involving French nationals.

title: Macron urges calm after far-right activist fatally beaten
International crew arrives at space station, carrying France’s second woman in space
Vatican asks ultraconservative Society of Saint Pius X to 'suspend' its plan to ordain bishops
subhead: The superior of the Society of Saint Pius X, heir to Marcel Lefebvre, traveled to Rome as the group entered into a standoff with Pope Leo XIV.

title: French gaming giant Ubisoft's future uncertain despite steady third-quarter 2025 results
subhead: Stronger-than-expected financial results in the third quarter of 2025 have not dispelled doubts surrounding Ubisoft, as the company faces restructuring, a toxic workplace climate and questions about its industrial future.

title: Paris's Museum of Romantic Life reopens with a fresh new look
subhead: The renovated museum has refocused the visitor experience on its first occupant, the painter Ary Scheffer, and the artistic and literary movement he belonged to.

title: The slow identification of Ukrainian soldiers killed at the front and returned by Russia
subhead: In Odesa, at one of Ukraine's forensic centers equipped for DNA identification, 2,300 bodies – handed over by the Russians under an agreement struck in June 2025 – wait inside refrigerated railway cars to be identified.

Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?
subhead: The Arctic has become a strategic focal point for countries, lying at the intersection of climate and geopolitical challenges. Climate change has sharply accelerated this transformation.

title: Saudi Arabia rethinks its cultural policy as foreign interests vie for funding
subhead: As the kingdom tightens its purse strings, French stakeholders have been working to protect their interests amid competition from the English-speaking world.

title: Mika opens the doors to his Tuscany villa: 'Throw us anywhere, and we'll make poetry'
subhead: The singer chaired the 41st edition of the Victoires de la Musique, France's annual music awards ceremony, on Friday, following the late January release of his seventh album, 'Hyperlove.' Currently on tour, he will perform in Paris on Monday.
